column4: Can someone help me? I have to somehow install Ubuntu onto a laptop HDD from a desktop, and then transplant it back in the laptop in some sort of working order.
sure ... do a usb-bootmedium, for safety disconnect desktop's hdd, need an adaptor for 2,5 hdd/lappi, then boot from usb-thumb and install to hdd
I can't change the boot order since the BIOS is locked. Wouldn't that require that?
no, as it'll probably be the only bootable medium then, though I don't know what your bios is set to, mostly one can hard-reset bios by opening the case
so can go above described way
to lower the risk, just do a basic/minimal install with all generic drivers (alternate or netinstall, expert-mode)
and brick .. chances are small it won't work, but you won't break anything
sound like grub wasn't installed properly, how did you try ?
Oh wow. I think I just figured out why that didn't work. I installed to an sda partition and that HDD also has windows on it. Would grub refer to Windows and fail because of that?
os not found is mostly grub not found
goole the manual for that exact model and find outm wheter to reset the bios manually/mechanically (removing battery..) is possible
All the pages I could dig up said no. But I'll try the manual as well.
so removing batt shall be possible then :)
It's worth a try. What's the worst that could happen *nervous chuckle*?
have a black tea, let it sit for longer than 6 minutes before drinking ;), then use the screwdriver
